Node.definition: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to remember|to call to mind|to be mindful|to bear in mind|to consider
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities reprocess information that is stored in their mind

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= state in which humans feel shame and humiliation, ◄ due to one's own shortcomings or misfortune and/or contempt from other people
= process by which objects that used to belong to someone become the possession of someone else
= a person considered as not belonging to a certain group, be it religious, ethnic, or social

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= person who comes from a foreign country and therefore has a different status from those who are native born

= person whose father has passed away and therefore unable to care for himself; ≈ regarded as one of the weaker members of the society and should therefore receive special care, together with the aliens, the widows, and other people who are poor

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort
= direct female progenitor; ≈ associated with affection and loyalty; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine

= woman whose husband has died and therefore has difficulty caring for herself; ≈ regarded as one of the weaker members of the society and should therefore receive special care, together with the aliens, the fatherless, and other people who are poor
= silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins
= a single piece of wood taken from a tree, cut and finished, and used for building and construction
= the amount of money expected, required, or given in payment for something
= part of the body connecting the rump to the head; ► a ;place to wear ornaments, but also a yoke; ≈ a stiff neck is associated with insolence and pride

Node.gloss: to grow weary|to wear oneself out|to labor|to toil
Node.definition: = action by which humans are engaged in laborious activity which requires a lot of energy and ultimately results in exhaustion
= nation and their territory; ◄ regarded as founded by one of the sons of Ham (חָם) with the same name
literally: to give (one's) hand (to someone); hence: = action by which humans accept the authority of other humans, or of a deity
= nation; ◄ located in Northern Mesopotamia with Nineveh (נִינְוֵה) as its capital; regarded as descendants of Shem (שֵׁם)
= process by which someone's desire for food is fulfilled
= a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general
= indirect male progenitor
= action by which a human being commits a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether or not on purpose, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse, including those associated to him or her
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
literally: hand; hence: = state of being in a position of control and authority over objects or people

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general
= action by which humans are engaged in an armed conflict with other humans, accompanied by deeds of aggression
= area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals
= the thin layer of tissue forming the natural outer covering of the body of a person or animal
= process by which an object grows uncomfortably hot
= a body condition caused by lack of food, ◄ described as a rise in temperature
= state of having a lack of food for a period of time, affecting an individual for a short time or a large number of people in a geographical area for a prolonged time (as in famine)
= woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not
= mountain; ► that part of Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם) on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of David (דָּוִד) YHWH's dwelling place

Node.gloss: to violate|to force (someone) to have sex|to rape
Node.definition: = causative action by which a man forces himself upon a woman and has non consensual sex with her ► and so brings humiliation upon her
= young unmarried woman, who has never been married before, and has never had sex with a man

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security

= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Leah (לֵאָה) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) and, after the exile, a separate administrative district
= someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere

= the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

= a council or a group of older men who act with authority on behalf of or over their people; some represent an entire nation, others manage the affairs at the town level; some provide their leader with counsel; involved in both judicial and military decisions, and participating in cultic ceremonies; ≈ expected to be wise and considered worthy of deference and respect

Node.gloss: to favor|to give preference|to show respect|to show partiality
Node.definition: literally: to respect (someone's) face; hence: = action by which humans gives other humans a preferential treatment over other people
= a young, fully grown, unmarried male ► associated with joy and strength

= set of two stones ► that are used to grind grain into flour; the grain was placed on the stationary bottom stone, and the top stone was pressed down on top of the grain and scraped back and forth; ≈ associated with hardness

Node.gloss: to take up|to lift up|to carry
Node.definition: literally: to lift up; hence: = action by which humans take hold of objects with their hands, with the intention of holding them or bringing them to another location
= a single piece of wood taken from a tree, cut and finished, and used for building and construction
= process by which humans trip or temporarily lose their balance when walking; ≈ often used figuratively to denote failure

= a council or a group of older men who act with authority on behalf of or over their people; some represent an entire nation, others manage the affairs at the town level; some provide their leader with counsel; involved in both judicial and military decisions, and participating in cultic ceremonies; ≈ expected to be wise and considered worthy of deference and respect
= a young, fully grown, unmarried male ► associated with joy and strength
= action by which humans play an instrument with strings, such as a lute (כִּנֹּור) or lyre (נֵבֶל) which can be for silent meditation or to accompany singing and dancing
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= process by which events take on a different nature
= a state of grief, caused by bereavement, loss, or other difficult circumstances, and which is shown by one's actions
= action by which humans dance a round dance; ≈ associated with joy
= process by which humans, animals, or objects move from a higher level to a lower level, typically at a high speed and without control

= circular or semi circular ornamental headdress, ◄ usually made out of precious metals and decorated with jewels, ► worn by kings, priests, and officials as a symbol of authority and status; also given to women by their suitors to win their affection

= upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities
exclamation expressing grief and dismay
= action by which a human being commits a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether or not on purpose, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution
literally, confused heart: = state in which someone is unable to think properly ◄ as a result of hardship
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers
literally: eyes are darkened; hence: = state in which the human eye can no longer see very well

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)
= mountain; ► that part of Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם) on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of David (דָּוִד) YHWH's dwelling place

= animal that looks like a longhaired dog with a pointed nose and a bushy tail; either reddish with white underparts (fox) or yellowish brown with red tips to the fur on the back (jackal); scavenger; ≈ associated with destruction and devastation, and also with being insignificant but self important
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move through an area without a specific destination
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future
= action by which humans or deities assume a position of leadership, ◄ as if sitting on an actual throne
the throne representing someone's position as monarch or judge
= all of the people born and living at about the same time
= all of the people born and living at about the same time
poetic term: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, usually in the future
= action by which animals, humans, or deities suspend their commitment to (other) objects, animals, humans, or deities, either temporarily or permanently
literally: length of days; hence: = an extended period of time
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
literally: to turn (someone to someone else); hence: = causative action by which humans or deities cause other humans to associate with deities, often to look for help and support

Node.gloss: to renew|to restore|to reaffirm|to reconfirm|to turn (to someone)
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities bring an event back to its original condition|literally: to turn (to someone); hence: = action by which humans or deities associate with other humans or deities, often to look for or to provide help and support
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
= set of particles marking an object or event as opposed to other objects and events
= state in which humans or deities are unwilling to engage in any way with (other) humans or deities, or with other objects and events
= state in which humans or deities are unwilling to engage in any way with (other) humans or deities, or with other objects and events
= process by which humans in a position of authority or deities respond with anger to a situation in which (other) humans have disobeyed an order or broken a law
= state in which an event takes place with a strong intensity
